workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 5.4 - New York Grand Central Circuit
workout_file.description: A race simulation on New York Grand Central Circuit where you'll tackle 3 laps of the course.

textevent.message: Welcome to another race simulation workout!
We're going to be tackling New York Grand Central Circuit today.
1st though, let's start off with a warmup, keep your cadence comfortable here.
All right, that's halfway through the warmup. Let's chat about what's in store for you today.
As you know, we're going to simulating Grand Central Circuit which is defined by the long KOM climb.
The climb is also interesting since it's not just 1 consistent grade.
Rather it has many steps of different grades which finishes VERY steep.
Which is of course followed by a nice long decent, and quick flat section before the climb repeats again.
Overall, this is one of the more challenging race courses on Zwift.
Let's carry on with the warmup.
Up next, we'll do a couple of high cadence efforts to wake the legs up a bit more.
Aim for 110+ RPM next.
GO GO GO! FAST FEET!
Good work, back to a comfortable cadence again.
Let's go! Get those legs spinning quick!
Excellent work! Now we'll take a moment and spin easy.
Take a few deep breaths here and sip some fluids before the race start.
We're starting off with a hard effort to get up to speed, then hitting the climb very soon after.
So, get ready to put the work in today!
GO GO GO!
Good work getting into the lead group! Just a short bit before we hit the climb.
The climb starts next, get ready to really ramp up the pace.
Push hard at the bottom to stay with the group. Splits will form over the climb.
Quick flat section, catch your breath before the next step.
This step is slightly steeper, keep digging!
Another quick flat section here.
The 3rd step is slightly less steep, keep working now!
Breathe...The final 2 steps are the most steep!
DIG DIG DIG!
Get ready to really push yourself to the top!
GO GO GO!
Excellent work! That's 1 climb down and 2 more to go.
Focus on recovery now and shake the upper body out if you're tense.
Remember to use the super tuck when you can on these long descents.
ALl right, almost to the bottom here. We have a short flat section, then we're climbing again!
Stay relaxed through this section and just stay in the group, save your energy for the climb.
An attack might try and go early before the climb starts, so pay attention here.
Almost to the climb again, take a deep breath and get ready to WORK!
Back onto the lower slopes again, push yourself and stay near the front.
Watch for splits on this climb, they'll be some tired legs the 2nd time up.
Another very quick flat section to catch your breath.
The slightly steeper 2nd step! Hang on now.
The 2nd selection group will have formed by now, just hang in the wheels here.
Get ready for the steepest parts of the climb.
GO GO GO!
Quick breather here, then get ready to push for the summit!
LET'S GO!
Great effort! That's 2 climbs down and just 1 more to go. Use this descent to rest up and recover.
Make sure you're drinking here, keep yourself hydrated and topped up with fluids.
We have that short flat section up next, stay relaxed here.
The group will likely be quite small now, just stay in the wheels and let them make the moves.
All right, the final climb is just ahead. You can do this!
Start strong!
Quick breather...Relax.
Stomp those pedals! Stay with the group here!
Great work! Nice and easy here.
Just a few more steps left and we've made it!
UP UP UP!
Easy now...Finish climb is just ahead.
GO GO GO!
Phew! Nicely done! Let's recover down this descent.
Breathe, shake things out, and get ready for the close of this race.
Almost to the bottom, get ready for some effort again.
Homestretch before the sprint! Stay calm and cool here, and watch for attacks.
Get ready to sprint for the line! DIG DEEP!
GO GO GO!
Grand Central Circuit, OUCH! Great work today, my friend!
Let's cooldown for a few minutes here, then hop off the bike
See you next time :-)
